skill.name: route
skill.description: Manually route a query to the optimal Claude model (Haiku/Sonnet/Opus)
skill.summary: Manually route a query to the optimal Claude model (Haiku/Sonnet/Opus)
skill.author: 0xrdan

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, network calls, or external commands. The skill only defines argument parsing logic and subagent routing behavior for the Claude Router system.

content.value_statement: Claude automatically selects models based on query complexity. This skill lets you override that selection and force a specific model for precise control over capability and cost.
actual_capabilities: Route queries to Haiku for simple, quick tasks
Route queries to Sonnet for typical coding tasks
Route queries to Opus for complex analysis
Validate model names and show help for invalid inputs
Support both short names and full model names
Prefix responses with model override information
limitations: Does not change the underlying model capabilities
Cost savings depend on choosing the appropriate model
Cannot route to models outside the Claude family

use_cases.title: Reduce API costs
use_cases.description: Force Haiku for simple queries to save on API costs while maintaining quality

use_cases.title: Ensure deep analysis
use_cases.description: Force Opus when you need maximum reasoning capability for difficult problems

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Enforce Sonnet as your team's default model for consistent results

prompt_templates.title: Quick question
prompt_templates.prompt: /route haiku What is the capital of France?

prompt_templates.title: Code implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: /route sonnet Write a function to validate email addresses in Python

prompt_templates.title: Complex analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: /route deep Analyze the security implications of this authentication flow

prompt_templates.title: Explicit Sonnet
prompt_templates.prompt: /route standard Design a caching system for a web application

output_examples.input: /route opus Design a REST API for a task management system
output: Result: Comprehensive API design with endpoints, data models, authentication, and error handling strategies

best_practices: Match model complexity to task complexity for optimal cost-performance balance
Use Opus for multi-step reasoning tasks that require deep analysis
Test with Haiku first for simple queries to verify expected quality
anti_patterns: Using Opus for trivial questions wastes resources
Forcing Haiku for complex problems leads to poor results
Ignoring the model's strengths for specific task types

faq.question: Which models are supported?
faq.answer: Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus. Short names (haiku, sonnet, opus) and aliases (fast, standard, deep) both work.

faq.question: What happens with an invalid model?
faq.answer: The skill displays usage help with available models and examples for correct syntax.

faq.question: Does this work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is compatible with Claude Code CLI tool for terminal-based model routing.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is prompt-only with no code execution, file access, or network calls.

faq.question: Why use manual routing?
faq.answer: Control costs, ensure specific capability levels, or standardize team workflows across different task types.

faq.question: How does this differ from auto-selection?
faq.answer: Auto-selection estimates complexity automatically. Manual routing gives you explicit control when you know the best model for your needs.
